message: I feel like I'm missing some fundamental flaw somewhere.

I've been f'ing around with some gems (adding some stuff) and I find that I want to go into IRB and play around with my modified gem (located at C:\Ruby192\lib\ruby\gems\1.9.1\gems). After I make changes I load up cmd.exe, punch in irb. I then do 'require gemname' and try to access the new methods I've created in the object but they don't seem to be there :(.
Maybe I should be asking how to load a custom .rb file into IRB?
I guess that didn't answer my overall question on how to modify an existing gem right in my folder and be able to 'require gemname' in irb.

Sigh, google for 5 minutes, don't find it, post question. Google for 5 more minutes, find it. I was using "load" but the path I was using didn't work. To load a .rb file into irb do it via "load './filename.rb' " .
